review: This mattress was bought for our daughters cot bed. Since this was first child, we wanted to make sure we get the very best we can afford.It is excellent quality mattress and in a price range we can afford. Admittedly I was a little hesitant due to the low price of the mattress. The ones sold in stores were at least twice the price and they didn't have the 'high' end features that this mattress claimed to have.All my worries were gone when the mattress arrived. The mattress comes with a removable cover, so easy to clean up after any spills etc. My daughter is too young to tell me if she finds the mattress comfortable. However I can take it as a positive indication when she sleeps soundly for hours on end. We've used the mattress for a number of years without any problem.Highly recommended for any family.

review_bold: Cities that work, and cities that don't
review: Jane Jacobs is the Edmund Burke of urban planning. I doubt there's any compliment higher than that. In Death and Life she takes on the modernist planners and their grand projects, visions of 'urban renewal' and single-use neighborhoods, that she says create uneconomical, unnatural, isolated and deadening urban spaces.Jacobs instead champions four factors that generate not only vibrancy, but economic viability.1. Mixed uses, with different street activities at different times of the day2. Short blocks, which allow high pedestrian permeability3. A mixture of old and new buildings of various ages (and states of repair)4. DensityThe examples here are a bit dated, but the book will make you think about your own environment and how we experience and use cities.

review: Several years ago I remember watching Mike Loades on TV with an excellent series about various weapons in which he used insights based on practical usage of weapons to explain military history in a different way. These insights are invaluable in understanding better how battles were fought and won. In this book he has gone even deeper, taking a number of swords from different periods of history and looking at them in depth, at their manufacture, design and use. He brings practical experience in wielding these weapons plus tremendous knowledge and enthusiasm. Blended together they make a tremendous book for anyone interested in history as well as swords and swordsmen.

review_bold: Interesting example of the time and enjoyable read
review: This is a small novel of just over 150 pages, split into 10 chapters and it's really easy to read. I have been given this book to read as part of a literature appreciation course - I read Room With A View many years ago but remember little of it and had not heard of this novel.The writing is brilliant from the start. It's very funny and the characters are compelling. Every sentence seems to contain some witticism - this is a novel which needs to be read slowly in order to catch everything.It is a short novel and the plot is straightforward - lots happens in such a few pages and it has to be straightforward. Forster clearly sets out back stories, relationships and potential for conflict.The plot takes the form of a farce with the characters rushing about without thinking of consequence - everything happens quickly with people and actions being exaggerated for comic effect. There are several elements of the plot which are simply preposterous and made me gasp!I found the book very implausible but understood that he was playing with stereotypes of the times. Once used to that then the book becomes quite sensitive as the characters are drawn to their fates.

review_bold: Well made, smart and extremely functional.
review: A great idea for the business man or student. It acts as a 'Portable Desk' and having got one of these, I've more or less stopped using my briefcase because this is so much more functional.Not only is it functional, it looks really smart and is very well made. Plenty of storage and individual spaces to store everything you're likely to need in any meeting. Everything is handy for you to access and unlike a briefcase, you can place this on a table and work from it and on it. Bigger and far more practical than your average 'conference folder'.The faux leather really looks genuine and the stitching is very nicely finished-off and the handle makes carrying it around a breeze!

review: This tiny action camera from Campark is really the dog's whats-its.These camera have become incredibly popular in recent times, as they are tiny and easy to carry everywhere. They are usually described as 'action camera' as they have fast shutter speeds and good video quality to allow you to catch fast moving subjects in sports.Most of these (cheaper) cameras I have seen have been ok, but stuck with 1080p resolution and cheap back screens with confusing buttons. This all singing, all dancing model is different.You can take 4K video (only at 24 fps though), and the stills can go up to 20 MP. And best of all, the back screen is finally a touch screen, which makes navigating the menus so much easier.The camera does not come with any storage on board, or an SD card, but micro SD cards are really cheap these days, so it shouldn't matter too much.As I said, you can take still pictures up 20 20MP, which makes them great for landscape shots as you can zoom in with minimal loss of detail. The video quality is ok, but 4K at 24 fps is not as good as 1080p at 50 fps (in my opinion). I have tried to include a sample of both for comparison, but Amazon will only allow one video per review. The video of the dogs is 1080 at 50 fps. The photos are both 20 MP.You get a nice semi hard case, plus a massive amount of accessories, mounts, sticky pads, and a fully waterproof case for shooting underwater. However, when the camera is in this case, you obviously cannot access the touch screen, but the button on the front allows you to cycle through all the modes, so minimal problems there. You also get a little remote control unit.The battery with the camera is only 150 mAh, so it might be an idea to take 2 or 3 along for a day's fun. Other cameras I have tried of this type have come with a spare battery in the case, so a bit disappointing not to receive a spare here. Charging the battery took about 2 hours.To get the photos off the camera, you can take the SD card out and stick it in your computer, or WiFi transfer is included. To use the WiFi with your phone is a bit complicated (well it was for me anyway). You have to create a new wifi connection to the camera, then download the 'CamKing' app (for Android, not sure about iOS), and view your pics on your phone. You can then download them to your phone, and finally I uploaded them to Google Photos to access them on the computer. Long winded, but once set up it works ok.A really nice camera, good quality capable of some very good shots/videos, and small enough to take around in your pocket.Thanks for listening.
product: Action Camera,Campark 4K 20MP WIFI Sport Camera Touch Screen Waterproof 30M SONY Image Sensor EIS Remote Control Dual 1050mAh Batteries with Portable Package and Kit of Accessories
label: CG

review: I grudge paying big money for shoes, I'd consider losing £50 on a horse easier to handle than shelling out £50 on a decent pair of trainers so these were right up my street price wise at 2 pairs for £20. I am not a slave to the label and was not expecting much but so far they are fine. Fit is good but I got the same trainer in 2 different colours and one is definately a lot roomier than the other and you can see the size difference when they are sat side by side so it looks like size is not strictly uniform.I read a few reviews saying the laces can rip through the material if drawn up too tight so I've bought elastic laces from Ebay for £1 to ensure this does not happen (I find them a lot easier to live with anyway).They are comfortable enough and no aches and pains in my feet come the end of the day but only time will tell as to their longevity, all in all I am very happy with them.

review: I used this pump from last summer (aka 1 year), it worked very well on both type of values. Well that was on till a week ago when my brother started using it for the Schrader part.He some how force the value into work and broke the plastic inside meat to open the value to let air in and out, don't ask me how. But if he had no used force I willing to bet I personal would never have had a problem, I was using both value, one for racer bike and the Schrader for my everyday bike.I love this pump and would buy it again if the post cost was lower. I am going to have to find it somewhere else to buy it as amazon no longer sell it personal.for under £7 you well not find a better pumpedited, My brother (the one that broke it) got me a new head for it and it is work great again look like i Don't need a new pump. (aka he got a new bit that you put on the values)edited 2, It is now 2014 this review was write in 2011, I am still using this pump, the head that my brother got still works brilliantly haven't had to replace it.edited 3, it 2016 and the rubbers in the pump are finally giving out, I think I will get away with lubing them to bring more life back to it. But considering this pump has been going strong for year. it both bikes and even the odd car. If lubing the rubbers doesn't give it more life I have to buy it again.

review_bold: Solid fit, great sound, great price.
review: I must have weird ear canals, because for years I was resigned to the idea that I just couldn't use earbuds. The old school, one-size hard plastic kind just never fit properly in my ears, were uncomfortable, and were constantly falling out.Times have changed, and I'm thrilled to find that these fit and work great. These fit more like earplugs, sitting snugly in the ear canal. They come with three different sizes of molded plugs to accommodate different sized ears. I wear them at the gym for extended periods and have had no issues with them becoming uncomfortable, coming loose, or falling out.I'm a musician and audio hobbyist, and have been very pleased with the sound quality. I wouldn't likely use them for critical listening, but for travel or the gym they sound great. And when (not if) I misplace them, they're cheap enough I can just pick up another pear.

review_bold: A good looking and effective set
review: This is a very stylish compact soap dispenser and steel soap bar set which should look good in any kitchen, backed up by the quality of Joseph Joseph.The soap dispenser fills easily by removing the pump and takes a whole bottle of your favourite hand wash (I like strawberry laces). Pressing the pump gives a suitable measure of soap, and any drips are caught on the plastic tray beneath. I don?t know how the steel bar removes the smells of garlic and onions but it does. The whole thing Is very neat and effective.You do need to look after the stainless steel, as residue from the soap can stain it, but otherwise this is a nice looking set which should last for years and save buying a whole new hand wash pump every time you refill.

review_bold: For the money it's a good all round multi gym
review: For the money it's a good all round multi gym. The drawing in the instructions looked like they were done by a 3 year old so there was a bit of head scratching trying to put it together. Your form has to be spot on for squatting using the bar or it will jam, however you do get 4 attachments for the gym which mean you can squat using a normal barbell.The bolts etc come on a cardboard backing with a plastic cover, when I opened the box one of these had come apart and I was missing bolts and nuts which was frustrating. I contacted the seller, got an email back and then 3 weeks later received some bolts - but no nuts (I wasn't waiting that long so went and bought some). It's worth knowing that the bolts and nuts are imperial, not metric.All in all my son uses it as well as myself, the cable cross overs are great as is the fly machine and for the price you can't go too wrong.

review_bold: Uncomplicated, leather RFID protected purse. Really well made and excellent VFM.
review: I like Lorenz purses - for inexpensive day to day use they're really well made and good value. The colour I ordered looked like an antique saddle brown leather on the pic, but the purse that arrived is actually what I'd call ox blood, a very dark, blackish claret, good colour, I like it.Purse has one main zipped compartment with four sections and a central zipped coin compartment. Good quality zips, all the compartments are fully lined and faultlessly stitched, no weak areas or missed bits.Studded opening on the wallet part reveals a capacious note compartment - easily big enough for £50 notes (not that I have ever seen many), £20 and £10 without having to fold them in half, and the pocket is deep enough to tuck them right in without the edges of the notes on view.There are three easy access pockets for cards, two concealed pockets for secrets, and a zipped pouchette. A smaller fold out windowed ID pocket with two more card slots on the reverse.The purse is RFID protected.I don't want a great big purse with hundreds of card slots, or loads of zipped compartments to confuse me and this one is just right.This purse measures 5.5" long, 3.5" height, an inch thick. Everything has been strongly stitched, sturdily built of quality materials and it should last for years.

review_bold: The truth is a lemon meringue!
review: The Mr Gum books are brilliant, wonderful, surreal creations that any child will love. Particularly those that love slightly disgusting, flights of fantasy and off-beat digressions. The characters are marvellous, the baddies are wonderfully evil and stupid and the heroes have their own comic foibles. Personally I prefer to read these myself so I can enjoy the word-play and sly jokes but this audio book is fun and the author does a good job. Buy every single one of them and read them to your children and friends. The world will be a better place for it.

review: This is an odd tale of one family from the Edwardian era through World War I into an uncertain future. Despite all the horrors of war and disease which are dealt with in detail, there is still a lightness and whimsicality to the novel and this doesn't quite work. It feels at time like a pastiche of the period, somewhere between Blackadder and Downton and loses its power. In his South American trilogy (which I love) the author moves effortlessly between humour and horror, in wonderful books that I would highly recommend.

review_bold: Nice much larger version of its little brother....
review: Had an older model of Nespresso and enjoyed very much. This is a much bigger version, so I have had to rearrange my worktops to fit it in, as kitchen is not huge, however it does look pretty smart! We found this to be very easy to use, a few buttons to press and that was all, we have been used to a smaller one though so unlike some other reviewers we found this very user friendly. We always heat the milk slightly in microwave and then add the coffee to it and its pretty yummy.. This machine excellent as you can have a larger cup of coffee now, this is exactly what we have been hoping for as it makes for a lovely any time of day superb cup of coffee. Now the only gripe I have is I am struggling to locate the new pods??? I will keep looking but they need to get these more readily available, maybe they will be soon.

review_bold: Good tasting, well cooked Chestnuts. Versatile and Squirrel proof.
review: I usually pick this brand up in Sainsburys but when I spotted a bundle pack of six of these for six quid with Prime on here, I couldn't press 'one click' fast enough.These are exactly the same as the 180g bags sold in the Supermarkets, really long shelf life while unopened, (this order in November '17 is good until August 2019) these are simply cooked, peeled and packed. Nothing else added.Cooked soft, but still retaining their structure, these are sweet and nutty. Excellent for sprouts, stuffings, puddings and cakes.Each pack contains the equivalent of a mugful of cooked chestnuts - if you were going to make this amount from fresh chestnuts, you'd need to start off with about 2lb chestnuts, because by the time you've boiled them, shelled them, taken off the 'paper' and removed the inevitable discoloured or dodgy bits, this 180g is about what you'd end up with. I know, because in the years that the squirrels actually leave me enough sweet chestnuts for my own use from my trees, this is about what I get.It's easier to leave the squirrels to their thievery and buy these.

review: I like bluetooth headsets. So much better than trailing wires everywhere.Obviously the build quality has to be good, and with these 'phones, it is.My only issue is with the fact that there is only one earphone. I wouldn't use these for listening to music (as they are only mono), they are designed for gaming use, hence the microphone, use them with x-box live or something.Everything you need is included. Charging time was about 2 hours (although you are advised to charge them for at least 4 hours initially), and the claimed talk time is 18 hours.The earphone (single) is quite comfortable and the microphone seems quite sensitive, no crackles or hiss heard or observed.Recommended for gaming.Thanks for listening.

review: If you liked "Dark Passion Play", then you'll love this.The first single, "Storytime" sets up the heavier tracks, but there's more to this album than pure overpowering music. "Slow, Love, Slow" is (admittedly heavy in places) is a swing style song. "Turn Loose The Mermaids" is a beautiful folk song. The longest track, "Song of Myself", is unusual in that fact that half of it is spoken.The second disc, like "Dark Passion Play", are instrumental versions. I really love these, and wish more bands with this style of music would do this. Sometimes I just want to listen to great music.Seriously, if like symphonic, over the top, music, you really need to listen to this.

review: Although I have only just bought a pet car seat cover a few weeks ago and it is still perfectly fine, my stepdaughter has got herself a puppy which doesn't travel to well at the moment so I bought this Plusmart dog seat cover so I can quickly change the covers over if the puppy has a little accident.The Plusmart seat cover looks well made and has adjustable straps to attach the cover to the rear and front seat head rests, so the cover can be used to just cover the back seat or used a bit like a hammock to help stop little terrors climbing over to the front seats.Which ever way you have the cover it only takes a few seconds to fit.There are two Velcro openings in the cover so seat belt buckles can easily be passed through the cover and there are also two button up pockets to store item's in.Only time will tell how durable the seat cover is but from the look of the build quality it should last a while even with a couple of dogs jumping all over it most of the time.If it does not last a while I will update my review.Thank you for taking the time to read my review, I hope it has helped in some way.If this review has helped in any way, in a positive or negative way please click the yes or no button below.

review: These things are incredible for the price. I've used earbuds regularly for over a months while exercising, while working in landscaping/farming, and presently as an attorney. The different types of work affect sound quality, given the types of ambient noise one experiences, the jostling of the headphones from movement, etc. In addition, I only buy headphones that are no more than £100, preferably less than £10, because I have a tendency to lose and/or destroy them. These are, hands down, the best pair I've ever had, even better than the £100 Beats I used to buy. The fit is perfect, they do not jostle around in your ear, and because the fit is so snug (without being annoying), they eliminate ambient noise extremely well. For example, on a plane you barely notice the engine sound (relative to any other headphones I've owned).And the sound quality is the best I've ever experienced by long shot for a pair of earbuds. The bass is deep and full, mids are actually pronounced, and the treble is not piercing like it is frequently in earbuds. The clarity for something like jazz is not perfect if your an audiophile, but still better than anything else at this price point, or at numerous price points above it.NOTE: In order to maximize sound quality, you have to use the rubber piece that fits snugly into your ear. You also HAVE to wear the R headphone in your right ear and the L headphone in you left ear. I guarantee the reviewers complaining about the lack of bass are not wearing them correctly. When you do, the sound is nothing short of astonishing for pair of budget earbuds.

review_bold: Top of the range bag at a very sensible price
review: There are two backpacks on this product page - I bought the larger 18 inch one.When I go out and about there are a few items I like to take. One body is enough, but with an ultra wide angle, standard and mild telephoto, plus a pair of flashguns I'm already up to 8 kg. I've got several bags already - a ridiculously small one from the camera makers, a simple canvas bag, and even a couple of Billingham 550's (that I bought many years ago when they were 20% of today's ridiculous price) but I've never had one bag that my minimum kit fitted into before now. Admittedly, there isn't a great deal of space left in the bag. I could slip a notebook computer into the outer pocket (though I won't!), and I'll try to work out how I can fit a ring flash and macro lens into the space that's left over, but the fact that I can take so much, and mount it on my back for easy carrying is fantastic.I've had a good look around the bag. The seams are all perfect, and the zips all work smoothly and well. It's been very well made. The material is showerproof, but the bag does come with it's own raincoat for when you're in the pouring rain. I'm delighted with it.

review_bold: Good basic introduction to John Wooden's life and phiosophy
review: This is quite a good, but short, introduction to John Wooden, his life and his philosophy. The book itself is more of a springboard to reading other books on John Wooden, or perhaps interesting someone else in exploring the full history behind this book. It does contain some interesting quotes. It is a very quick book to read, taking about 15 minutes. As a free book, I highly recommend it, although if I had to pay for it this would not be a good book at all.

review_bold: Discreet and charming Poppy lapel brooch.
review: Pretty, discreet little lapel pin measuring just under 1.5" tall and an inch across. Covered with tiny, gold outlined, enamelled red poppies with black rhinestone centres on the upper surface. Plain on the reverse with a fastener which has a securing clasp.Presented in a cellophane packet inside a red plush drawstring baggie.Almost lost the fifth star as the fastening feels a bit dainty to my fumbling fingers, but it's got the benefit of the doubt, for now.I like the style of this little brooch - the message is quite clear, without being OTT.There isn't any donation from the sale of this brooch to the British Legion's charity.I tend to put some money in the collecting boxes anyway, but I don't care for the traditional poppies, so I don't take one - then my poppy wearing colleagues gang up and accuse me of ignoring the appeal.This attractive little brooch will do a good job of keeping the naysayers off my back, and I bet they'll all be wanting one.

review: This is a decent state-of-the-art Android box, with android 6.0 preloaded. It's got the right processor for watching video, with plenty of RAM (twice as much as it needs) for coping with 4K, and a good 16GB of storage. If you're a storer, then 16GB might not be enough for you, but in these days an extra memory card that will fit in its external slot is very reasonable indeed.It is a pure Android box at the moment. It's very easy to load Kodi from the Google Playstore, which is included there already. The box can also be used to play games, or to do anything else that you'd do with an android phone or tablet. Do remember to get a couple of batteries (AAA) for the remote control, but once you've done that everything is really simple. Power lead in, HDMI cable (supplied) into a spare slot on your TV or monitor, and that's it. Connect to your wifi and you're off!

review_bold: Great digital multi-meter with lots of features
review: The Tacklife digital multi-meter comes with1 pair of test leads1 K-type thermocouple lead1 user manual4 AA BatteriesThe Tacklife multi-meter looks and feels well made, with it looking like it is able to take a few knocks and bumps.The Tacklife digital multi-meter has a large good clear LCD display with a backlight that can be turned on if needed, it takes four AA batteries which are supplied.To fit the batteries the battery compartment can be located just under the multi-meters stand and can be easily accessed by removing a single screw.The main test leads and the K-type thermocouple lead feel well made and the plugs on the leads fit nicely into the sockets on the multi-meter.I got this Tacklife digital multi-meter to replace a fairly old analogue multi-meter I have.I am no expert in electronics and will probably never use most of the features on this digital multi-meter but its nice to know the features are there if I need them.The main things I personally will be using this multi-meter for are testing fuses, to see if a circuit is live and working and to find live cables inside walls which this multi-meter can do.ConclusionSo far I am very happy with this digital multi-meter it has a good clear display, feels robust and does what I need it to.I do find the user manual a little confusing.Thank you for taking the time to read my review.[...]

review_bold: Does not get better for the price!
review: So I had been using my ipod earphones for months, but I never liked them; they never fit well and I could not hear well. I like earbud type earphones because they fit in the ear canal and I have no problem listening to whatever it is I'm listening to, and they block noise better. I got these because they were cheap, no other reason, but was pleasantly surprised. The first thing I noticed was the deep bass, I dont love it but It's still better than the flatness of my old earphones. Sound quality is pretty good (again, for the price). And my wife gets mad at me because I don't listen to her (meaning these are pretty good at blocking nagging... I mean, noise.

review: So after my bluetooth earbuds stopped working, I quickly set out to purchase a new pair of earbuds (because the Apple iPhone earbuds are really bad...) and found these. I must say, for only £10, these things are amazing. I've used earbuds before that cost me £20 and were total junk, but these are only £10 and are just amazing. They fit nicely in my ear and don't slip out, even with lots of head movement. They're also very comfortable, but wearing them for more than 45 minutes will make your ears hurt a bit. The sound quality is also top-notch as well! I can't notice anything wrong with my music when using these, but then again, I'm not much of an audiophile. The quality is good enough for me!Overall, these are THE BEST earbuds you will get for under £10.

review_bold: It is laugh out loud only if you're not easily offended
review: After watching a lot of Frankie Boyle material I though I'd read his book. It actually is quite laugh out loud funny at points, and is actually an autobiography of sorts, mashed in with random diversion in his story. It actually feels quite rambling at times. The book is quite offensive so I would only read it if you can stomach his brand of comedy. Why 3 stars? It is quite rambling and I don't know if I'd have read it or even finished it if I didn't like his comedy. On the plus side I read it start to finish (an achievement for me!) plus at times it was actually laugh out loud!

review: I bought it as a watch to wear to work - something cheap and easy to wear whilst being fun. At first it was ok but after only a few wears I realised that the coil was so tight that it dug into my slim wrist and bruised, so I had to wear it twisted so that the watchface was on the edge of my wrist not flat on top, which meant telling the time at a glance wasn't easy at all. Then after a couple more weeks of wear, the silicone along the edge of the strap began to wear away revealing the metal beneath and the watch face holding part became malformed because the metal strap had bent and so the watch face fell out. It was in the bin within the month.

review_bold: Great case, but not for Sony DSC-HX20V
review: This is a really smart, well constructed compact digital camera case.On paper, the internal dimensions should accommodate a Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX20V, and the camera itself does just about fit. However, if you want to keep the provided lanyard attached to the camera then getting it in and out of the case becomes extremely fiddly.I cannot fault the case itself, and I was very much looking forward to using it. However, if you are purchasing for a Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX20V, I recommend looking elsewhere.

review_bold: So nearly perfect! A welcome record of a much-loved show.
review: Review of double-disc blu-ray set.Saw the original at Drury Lane once - not that impressed. Saw the 2014 production, as seen here, and saw it again and again - such an improvement in terms of pace, staging, you name it! Day seats meant that I was on the front row of the stalls numerous times for just £20 - brilliant!And now we have the film of the show. I saw it at the cinema. For some reason, the volume was so low that you could hear the subwoofers from the action movies on other screens, not to mention the munching of popcorn and slurping of drinks, so I'm looking forward to watching this movie on my terms!OK - it's a brilliant record of a brilliant show. The cinematography is superb. The only fault I can find is that editing room floor must have been littered with the footage filmed from the static cameras that must have been there on the night of the 25th Anniversary Performance. Cameras that must have filmed the stage as a whole. One of the reasons I loved this production was that the stage was used to its full extent. You could look left and right and see other stuff. "Dressing the stage", I believe. When Alistair Brammer is giving his truly stupendous rendition of "Why God Why" stage left, there is a wonderfully understated bar scene stage right. I mean, I'm not complaining that the camera spent a lot of time on close-ups of Mr Brammer during this scene, but the atmosphere the bar actually adds is lost. During "What a Waste", there is action everywhere - a few wide shots would have been very welcome. Almost nothing of the go-go boy as he teases the Mormon - one of the funniest parts of the show. Instead, to put across the delightful mayhem of this scene, there are lots of, well, close-ups. Superimposed. Moving across the screen like those old films of firework displays where they tried to cram as many actual bursts of stars as they could. I'd rather have a little more choice of where to look.Even in the final scene - the one which I thought was ruined by the addition of Ellen, the Engineer and John faffing about with Tam stage left, while (is this really a spoiler?) Chris bids farewell to Kim stage right - the film does a close up of Chris/Kim and all but ignores the others.It was a big theatre with a wide stage. The production team did a fantastic job filling the stage. That is sadly missing here.Rant over! There is plenty to praise in this film:There can be very little of the actual 25th Anniversary Performance left. Most of the shots are clearly from Steadycam on stage, which will have been filmed after the event. This actually makes the film more interesting, as swings and new cast members had joined the show. It was fun debating "Well, I'm sure Niall was the Mormon at the start of 'What a Waste', but that wasn't him later on upstage with the pole dancers." It was also great to see that all the cast members had their close-ups. A very nice touch.The colours are strangely muted - especially in Act II. For example, Ellen's hideous lemon-yellow dress (who thought that was a good idea?) looks almost sepia in the film and decidedly more tasteful as a result.The close-ups show the amazing performances being given. Eva Noblezada - a truly remarkable find - and Rachelle Ann Go express such a depth of emotion it truly has to be seen in close-up.I strongly recommend this film. It's not quite as effective as the film of the Australian production of Love Never Dies in terms of portraying an actual stage performance - Miss Saigon looks more like it was filmed on a sound stage rather than in a theatre - but it is still an excellent portrayal of a much-loved show.

review_bold: Good sound for a great price.
review: I like the headphones. They produce a nice, clear sound, and fit in my ears without falling out. They do reduce some outside noise, but amplify your heartbeat and breathing (mostly noticeable during quiet songs coupled with intense workouts). They come with three sizes for the earbuds. The only complaint I have is that the plastic part of the earbuds (not the rubber part that molds to your ear and can be replaced) hurts my ears after a while.Edit: They no longer hurt my ears! Either I grew used to them, or I was putting them in wrong (and no, I'm sure I had the left and right buds in their correct ears).

review: This is my review of : Mini Chopper, BESTEK Food Processor Glass Bowl 4 bi-level Blades, Perfect for baby food, Meat, breadcrumbs, chutney, onions,etc (300W 1.2 L)My daughter recently left home to live in student accomadation at university so i thought she might find this a useful addition to her kitchen No doubt her kitchen will not be a large and since she will be cooking for herself this little mini food processor might be just what she needs. I thought I would give it a quick road test myself first.Using the device could not be simpler. Put the food items into the bowl, place the lid and blades in position, fit the bottom of the motor housing unit into the groove on the lid top and holding the unit in place press down on one of the 2 large buttons on the top of the motor. The first button is for slow speed and the second is for the high speed setting I found the 300w motor converted my ice cubes to snow in just a few seconds and an onion was finely chopped in equally quick time. I see no reason why it should not be able to cope with all the culinary chopping and dicing needs of a single person or couple.The mini chopper comes with a silicone base ring to keep the unit from sliding around when in use/4 sharp blades to make light work of any chopping you want to do/a good quality reasonably sized glass bowl and 2 speed settings so that you have all the power you need for chopping all kinds of vegatables.This is an excellent little gadget with no real drawbacks that i could see.A great buy indeed.The GoodGreat Build qualityGreat pricePowerful motorAttractive designTwin speedsGood User GuideThe badnone that i could find.If you found my review helpful please click on the YES button. Thanks

Not as bad as first stated, but certainly not good enough - this battery costs around £5 on eBay, which is a more realistic price. By the time he comes home from school his phone is dead. review_bold: Great chair at a sensible price.
review: This is a chair to be seen in, really. You don't buy a chair with red stripes unless you're intending to become the envy of your friends!This seat took me about 30 minutes to assemble. The result is a very comfortable, well padded gamer's chair, that's actually comfortable, has castors that work well and a decent gas strut. Though maybe younger people are it's target audience, it seems strong enough and wide enough for me to sit on, and I'm not very small or petit. The 12 year old who's been after this because all his friends have one is absolutely delighted. While I'm typing this he's sitting with matching headphones on his X box, as happy as anything.He's pleased with it, so therefore so am I. I'm particularly pleased that I've got it delivered free and the total price is less than a third of what some of his friends' parents have paid.

review: These earbuds fit great and are very secure when I move around. They also do a great job of blocking outside noise. The sound quality is fine for me - I usually listen to podcasts and radio broadcasts and I'm not much of an audiophile, but as far as I'm concerned, these buds sound terrific.I wish the wires were a little thicker and not so prone to tangling when in storage, but for he price I'm not going to complain. I've ordered a second set to have in case I lose these.This is the fifth set of earbuds I've tried in search of something that would stay in place comfortably while moving around, including 2 different ear-hook styles, and these are the best by far. They're also the cheapest. Go figure.

review_bold: One of the best at this price
review: I put 4 starts for this graphic card because the only problem I have, is with air flow. Even with 2 fans the average temp is 36-38 on idle and 60-65 on games, so I put on my case side another fan in front of it and now average temp is 28-30 idle and 45-50 on games. If you have space for another fan definitely you should buy. I play my games on 1920x1080 with high settings with no problem average FPS is 75-80. On ultra high settings drop around 40-50. On medium well more than 100 FPS.

review_bold: Promising title but overall package is just average
review: Looking at everything in the description this CD was quite promising - a combination of video game music performed by an orchestra. I can't doubt the musical excellence here but I just feel the overall concept falls a bit flat. While this may work as a live orchestra piece, I just can't see this being something I would pop into a CD player on a whim. The music selection is up for debate, but certainly has some of the best musical pieces from video games. It is translated well into orchestra format, but I just feel there is no joy for me listening to video game music without the video game. Combined with this the premise of different video game's music has the whole CD sound a bit disjointed. Some of the selections just stand out as probably not suited to an orchestra, whereas others were more written for an orchestra originally. I can't criticise this musically, but whilst the premise was good I think in reality it just is not suited to be replayed on CD.

review_bold: Good product, use it in every wash
review: Giving 4 stars as -yes - "I Like It" (as Amazon qualitatively interprets a 4-star score). I'm not really sure it makes whites that much whiter. I don't have a lot of empirical evidence, meaning comparing whites washed with Vanish vs ones without the magic powder. Eventually my whites do turn a bit more grayish and I do have to give them charity.Where does it work then? Why do "I Like It"? the biggest thing is that it greatly reduces deodorant stains under the armpit. I have had nice (and expensive) white shirts ruined by a yellowish fade that occurs under the armpits where one applies deodorant. Even "stain free" deodorant leaves stains in the long term (has to do with certain chemicals in the deodorant). Vanish White has a noticeable impact in preventing these stains... it does not however remove them if already present.I've been trying the "Gold" gel which is more expensive and I havent seen any additional benefit FWIW

review: Love these headphones. My favorites, hands down. I'm sure there are more expensive brands that are also amazing, but I don't want to pay the money. I have three pairs that I keep in various parts of my house, I wear them at home and take them to the gym with me 4 days / week. The sound is awesome, for me the earbud fit is perfect--just right. I prefer these over my husband's bose headphones--those don't go deep enough into my ear and the sound is inferior. I also don't like the way those fit. Buy these--buy several! You will not regret it!

review_bold: A very good bike let down by small issues
review: I have now had the bike a few weeks and I can say I'm very happy with it. The bike was easy to assemble and it's very sturdy and comfortable to use. Being 6ft 5in I had my reservations that it would be ergonomically designed for me to use for prolonged periods of time, but I'm happy to say I certainly can and I've found both the seat and the body position I use cause me no ill effects. The seat and the handle bars are fully adjustable to various hights whilst the seat can also be moved closer or further away from the handle bars for even greater comfort.Now the reason for the 3 stars: unfortunately I had to return my first bike within 24 hours due to it developing a high pitched squeak, I did try to ascertain where the problem was originating from but to no avail; most of the bikes workings are shielded in plastic preventing any attempt at lubricantion. The problem was delt with effectively via email with the company and I received a replacement within 3 days (Very good customer service)The second issue I have is that whilst the assembly instructions are clear and concise there are no instructions on how to use the accompanying display screen/ monitor. The monitor comes with various settings from distance cycled, calories burnt, time elapsed etc, there is also one for what I believe is a pre-programmable setting but without any information on how to program this a lot of guess work was/is involved before you can get the best out of your workout. One final comment about the monitor is that whilst the casing is large with a place to put a iPad/or phone etc the actual LCD display in very small if not minuscule which is rather a pity, it doesn't detract from being able to read the display but I do feel a larger LCD would be more beneficial.To summarise I do think the bike is worth investing your money in as without the squeak problem I experienced you will have a very good bike to use. But alas these small and simple issues have resulted in 3 stars rather than what I think could well be a 4 or even a 5.

review_bold: Stylish, portable and splash-proof. Limited to Bluetooth and aux only though.
review: Summary - if you want a portable, splash-proof, Bluetooth speaker and aren't bothered about aptX then this is a good choice. Don't get the grey one if you like chocolate!Like Liberatone's Zipp Mini, the One Style is labelled as 'Made for' Apple devices. Unlike the Zipp Mini though, AirPlay is not an option so Bluetooth levels the playing field somewhat. To get the most out of it though does require the Liberatone app, available from the Apple App Store and Google Play. There is also an aux input for mini headphone jack connections hidden under a rubber flap on the back, along side the mini-USB charging port. A charging lead is provided but no mains plug so you'll need to charge from a computer or use a separate adaptor. AptX Bluetooth does not appear to be supported, but Bluetooth 4.1 is so the 4G signal quality of a connected phone is not impaired.That rubber flap is important as the One Style is splash-proof, as also evidenced by the rubber strip that covers the edges and also provides the handle/hook on the corner. It's a nice looking device though the grey material covering the drivers is easily marked. Like if someone in your house picks it up while eating a Cadbury's Flake. Most of the chocolate marks came out but not all! If you do intend taking it out and about you might want to consider a darker colour.Once paired, from the Liberatone app you can play 5 preset radio stations, but these can't be selected from the device directly. You can also adjust the sound, choosing from an adjustment ranging from smooth jazz to rock. Otherwise select your music app of choice and off you go. The sound comes out of both sides of the One Style but each side sounds slightly different: the front (with the volume and control dial) has more of the midrange and bass while the rear has more of the treble.This can be a little strange at first. I found the most balanced sound came with the One Style sitting edge-on facing me but it then feels like it's not playing 'to' you. Putting it on a shelf with the rear wall to bounce the sound off worked better. There is plenty of detail to the sound, decent bass and it goes pretty loud. As a Bluetooth speaker I prefer the Soundblaster Roar, which is easier to place with the sound coming from front and top but the Roar is heavier and doesn't have a convenient carry handle (nor is it splash-proof).

review: This is a thinly veiled account of mobsters from the thirties into the sixties where there is a lot of fun to be had in working out who the characters are based on, Frank Sinatra being the easiest. Although a slow starter it does finally get going and the story is entertaining enough, in a Mario Puzo style. It is forced to tie things up neatly with a Hollywood ending which is a shame as an Ellroyesque trilogy would have been interesting.

review_bold: Hit the 'Add to Cart' button now!
review: I have bought sooooo many pairs of crap headphones at this price...but no more! These are the best headphones you can buy under 10 bucks. No doubt about it. They block out sound and have decent (but not overpowering) low end. Multiple sizes of pads make for a great almost custom fit. Like I said, they block out a good chunk of noise for a headphone at this price. They will make your breathing seem louder during heavy workouts, but they don't fall out of the ear and now you don't have to listen to that dude grunting every time he picks up a freekin dumbbell. Sound, fit, and price aside, one of the coolest features is a little bump of plastic on the left ear. This is there so you don't have to look at what ear each bud goes into. I know many headphones have this, but c'mon, we could have used that tech decades ago! Buy and be happy you found the best headphone under 10 bucks.

review: Review for RE210.Set up was no problem, I did it manually, I've never been a fan of WPS.This is quite good value, a trusted brand name at a very reasonable price (£22, I notice it's gone up). It is only an extender, no access point functionality exists.I selected high speed mode... one band connects to the router, the other is used to connect to devices. It provides excellent quality and makes full use of bandwidth. The standard mode has both channels open - speed is less but devices can choose to connect on either 5 or 2.4 GHz.When devices connect, they appear on your main router with a spoofed MAC address, and a new IP. If you've made any special configs based on MAC, you'll have to revise it. Maybe all extenders do this, I've never used one before.I brought the WiFi closer to my fire TV stick. Anyone having WiFi issues with fire TV stick may be interested to note that the issues do not go away even when the WiFi is less than a metre from the device with 'very good' signal. It still drops the connection frequently.

label: CG
review_text: Review for RE210.Set up was no problem, I did it manually, I've never been a fan of WPS.This is quite good value, a trusted brand name at a very reasonable price (£22, I notice it's gone up). It is only an extender, no access point functionality exists.I selected high speed mode... one band connects to the router, the other is used to connect to devices. It provides excellent quality and makes full use of bandwidth. The standard mode has both channels open - speed is less but devices can choose to connect on either 5 or 2.4 GHz.When devices connect, they appear on your main router with a spoofed MAC address, and a new IP. If you've made any special configs based on MAC, you'll have to revise it. Maybe all extenders do this, I've never used one before.I brought the WiFi closer to my fire TV stick. Anyone having WiFi issues with fire TV stick may be interested to note that the issues do not go away even when the WiFi is less than a metre from the device with 'very good' signal. It still drops the connection frequently.

review_bold: Beautiful little novel full of unique character - a romance without a love story
review: I loved the unique quality of this author's previous novel "The Presidents Hat" so was looking forward to trying this one.The novel is 215 pages, split into many, titled, chapters.Again this story has a really interesting story at it's core. A middle aged doctor receives a letter from a recording company asking him to go to a meeting along with his band members to discuss a possible contract - the problem is that the letter has arrived 33 years too late. The band members have all moved on but Alain decides to try to track them down so he can listen to the original song again.There is plenty of dark comedy alongside much pathos. All the characters have regret and have changed in many ways.Using this seemingly superficial topic, the author dives into the modern France, exploring its political and artist scene with plenty of comments on them both.The book is set in France but this state of the nation novel could be set in many western countries with their extreme politics and people desperate for change.It is a small book but covers such a wide range of topics without ever going off course or preaching.

review: The Matcc car cover comes in its own little bag, so it can be kept tidy and compact when not being used.When first removing the cover from it's bag the first thing you notice is how light and thin the cover feels and looks.I'm not saying this is a bad thing because the material that is used to make the cover feels strong and does not feel like it will tear easily.The material that is used looks like the same material they sometimes use to make hammock's out of.The main stitching around the bottom sides of the cover does not look very well sewn but the stitching around the elasticated front and back part of the cover does look a lot better as does any other stitching on the rest of the car cover.I personally got this Matcc car cover to use mainly over winter when expecting ice or snow so I haven't been able to try it out properly yet in that type of condition but since using it I have been impressed with it.I am using the Matcc car cover with a Kia Venga with the cover fitting over the car nicely.The front and back of the car cover at the bottom of it is elasticated so it fits nice and snuggly around the front and back of your car.The cover has four ties sewn on to it that line up with the wheels of your car so the cover can be tied down to each wheel, there is also a long strap that is sewn to the car cover that lines up to the middle of your car.This strap goes underneath your car and attaches to the other side of the car cover to hold it down even more securely.It only takes a couple of minutes to put the car cover on to your car and tie it down and even less time to remove it.The only awkward part is placing the main strap underneath your car but having a long stick or pole helps push the strap underneath the car.Another nice feature of this Matcc car cover is it has two pockets on it that the door mirrors fit in to.There are also reflective strips on the front and back of the cover as well as the door mirror pockets.So far I have been impressed with this Mattcc car cover but it is not perfect apart from the sewing on the bottom sides of the car cover the ties that go around the wheels and the strap that goes underneath the car could be being a little thicker especially the main strap that goes underneath the car.If the ties and strap we're a little thicker I would give this Mattcc car cover 5 stars but as they are now can only award it 4 stars.Thank you for taking the time to read my review, I hope it has helped in some way.If this review has helped in any way, in a positive or negative way please click the yes or no button below.

review_bold: Great Quality for a Reasonable Price
review: These are some of the best in-ear headphones I've ever bought. I first tried them out on one of my favorite songs that I listen to often so I could easily compare them to other earbuds I have. I was honestly amazed at what I heard, it was like hearing the song for the first time, the quality was that much better. I've bought more expensive earbuds that accomplish less. The three best parts of this product are: 1) low price for great quality, I got these for about £10; you could probably find something superior but it would likely cost £100 and it would only be marginally better 2) extremely comfortable, the ergonomic design works great and I sometimes don't realize they are in my ears if music isn't on, 3) I love my music more; certain songs with a lot of base sometimes used to annoy me but they sound so much better with these headphones that I have changed my mind about those songs. When I bought these, the description didn't mention it, but they do come with the normal three sizes for the rubber part that goes in your ear, with the middle size already attached. They have worked flawlessly so far, but I've only had them for about a week, so I'll update my review if anything goes wrong later on.

review: Lexar, High Speed Class 10, micro Secure Digital High Capacity Memory CardOver the years, mobile phones have become an essential part of our modern lives. They are versatile and powerful tools which pack the very latest technology in the palm of our hands. To take full advantage of the features offered by these devices, the demand for digital storage space has increased more and more over the years.I bought the huge 32GB Lexar memory card for my smartphone. A the time, this had double the storage capacity of my device. It was the most cost effective way of 'upgrading' your phone.For any given memory device, there are two speed specifications that you need to bear in mind, namely, the read and write speed. The faster the read speed the more rapid is the rate of data transfer to your computer. The higher the write speed the faster the images are saved onto the memory card. A Class 2 speed translates to write speeds of 2MB per sec. This is the sustained writing speed as opposed to the maximum instantaneous write speed, the number shown on the memory card. Therefore a class 10 card will achieve 10MB/sec.I have not experienced any problems with data corruption when using trusted brands like, Lexar. You also receive a good quality card reader. It is worth noting the image quality is unaffected by the type of memory card used. However using a low speed (say class 2) will process the information more slowly. It may also be less reliable and may corrupt you data more readily when used in high demanding applications.I purchased this item at full price. If the product is unworthy of a good review, I think it is unfair to leave positive feedback as this can mislead potential buyers. I hope you found the review helpful. review_bold: Another great value product from Amazon Basics
review: This is another high quality low price item from the Amazon Basics range. A set of three suitcases which should be large enough for most family holidays.Each case has the same extending handle, durable wheels and handy pockets and pouches in the liner. The opening is via zips which are again of a good quality. There is a further zip to give you a couple more inches of space should you come home with more than you left. The plastic material feels durable yet is quite light considering the size of these cases. And they all stack into each other for storage. The handles are a good length and the wheels allow for pulling across a smooth surface - either upright on all four or tilted on two. There are also carrying handles on the top and side and feet opposite to allow the cases to sit upright in different orientation.My only slight reservation is that the feet seem a bit exposed, and I am not totally convinced that they would stand up to repeated airline baggage stresses. Time will tell and I will update if required.

review_bold: Fragrance & colour free bio powder. Very good results with light to medium soiling. A lot of powder needed for heavy staining.
review: This is a biological washing product for whites and colours, specifically designed for sensitive skin, with no added colour or perfume. The packaging is designed for the European market, with a number of languages on it. I've tried several washes with it on both cotton and synthetics.The dosage recommendation is in ml, which is a little odd for a powder product.I found it most effective on lightly soiled to medium soiled garments, using the recommended soft water dosages of 71 ml. Clothes felt and looked clean. The dosage instructions on the back of the pack advised using 125 ml for heavy soiling in a soft water area. That's quite a lot of powder. I used my own marked measuring scoops to measure out the correct amount. One ketchup stain on a top was removed, but a mud smeared pair of socks that had fallen from the washing line still bore faint traces of a mark.My machine is a Bosch, and my normal biological gel and scoop of stain remover would have removed the stain without extra product. I'll use stain remover powder with this in future, and the powder at a lower dose. This way I'll get nearer the 18 washes per pack that the product is supposed to contain.Like most biological products, it can't be used with wool or silk.

Clothes felt and looked clean. The dosage instructions on the back of the pack advised using 125 ml for heavy soiling in a soft water area. That's quite a lot of powder. I used my own marked measuring scoops to measure out the correct amount. One ketchup stain on a top was removed, but a mud smeared pair of socks that had fallen from the washing line still bore faint traces of a mark.My machine is a Bosch, and my normal biological gel and scoop of stain remover would have removed the stain without extra product. review_bold: Good. Just does what it's supposed to, and the pen and eraser are magnetic too.
review: This is a great item, that does just what you'd want. The surface is ideal for dry board markers, and its magnetic back works well, holding it to a steel fridge door. The pen and the eraser also come with magnets, so they can also hang handily on the surface, up above the height of little children's hands. The pen is refillable, though to be honest I don't think the amount of writing our board will get will use its ink up quickly, and you can use any dry wipe pen on the board anyway.If you've not had one on your fridge before, you don't know what you're missing!

review_bold: Don't expect it to last long or for Brother to actually help. Flawed model.
review: Avoid! The paper started to exhibit indentations and creases in the prints after just 13 months light use. On further investigation it was found the fuser roller had developed lots of 'lumps'. Called Brother Support and they told us to go away. They didn't want to know. A fuser unit should last for more than 2000 prints! We were even prepared to meet Brother halfway but the support guy just didn't want to know.Called the local Brother Service centre just in case and they told us it would be £240 to repair- but not to bother. They had several of this exact machine in with the same fuser fault. Even Brother Service Centres hate this machine!Buy something else from another company. I buy a lot of gear and won't be buying Brother again.

review_bold: An incredibly useful thing to have around
review: Sugru is a very versatile handy thing to have around any house. You open up one of the little packs and mound it into whatever shape you require and after a number of hours it sets into a firm rubber. I have used it to repair broken plastic and rubber handles, to improve or fix strain relief bit so on cables, add non slip things to slippy surfaces, make hooks to hold cables, and many other things. There are literally hundreds of uses for this around the house, garage and car. I always keep some in the fridge (it has an expiry date and apparently lasts for longer if you keep it cold.)

review: I received this as a gift last Xmas. I charged it up for the required 12hrs then tried to use it to inflate my tires. However, the socket doesn't seem to grip the valve properly. No matter I thought, I can still use it as a jump-start in an emergency. I'm glad I've never been stuck, as I checked the battery about 3 months later, and it had gone flat, but not only that, it will not recharge! It also has a terrible build quality, with sharp edges, ill-fitting covers and an accessory door that will not stay in place. This may be the crappiest product I have ever encountered.

review_bold: These sound awesome, especially for the price
review: These sound awesome, especially for the price. The sound is very clean, though the bass is a little weak. I bought a pair of the Amazon Basics In-Ear Headphones at the same time to compare. The Amazon Basics Headphones are good, but the sound is not nearly as clean as these. The bass in the Amazon Basics headphones is much better, but the sound is a bit grainy and distorted in my opinion. The headphones are comfortable, and the shape of the ear buds nicely indicate which ear they go in, with out having to look at the R/L letter, a nice touch if you're putting them on in the dark. The quality of the materials these are made with feels good, but the Amazon Basics feel a bit better. However, I purchased a pair of these two months ago which still work today. I bought these because one of my kids took my old pair to use. Finally, beware of the packaging, they are hard to get into and the extra ear cushions (Small/Large) will go flying. I would buy these again.

review_bold: Really nice wallet Only have some minor criticisms of it
review: Really nice walletOnly have some minor criticisms of it, like one of the note compartments has a hole in the bottom which is like the size of a 10p, so coins in that compartment could fall out the bottom.The supposed "coin compartment" is only big enough to fit 2 fingers in so getting coins out is super fiddly, I feel like they could've maybe made it a little longer, or just use a horizontal zip instead of a vertical one.And on the card holder compartments there are a few plasticy strands which are fraying on mine that would have to be removed and could potentially cause the material to separate if it happened more.Might be personal preference but I think I would've liked a button/zip/velcro thing to keep the wallet closed

It easily and reliably does everything that I want it to. Email, browsing, taking and viewing photos and videos, Skype, YouTube, Facebook, maps. GPS is fast. Connection (both mobile and wifi) is good and consistent. The battery always lasts me a full day. It looks and feels strong / easy to care for, and feels strong and easy to care for, and still looks new after 8 months of constant use.

review_bold: I can't believe how amazing these £10 earphones sound
review: Wow, I can't believe how amazing these £10 earphones sound!!! For any of you who are complaining that they don't sound good...please hook them up to a sound source that has good power or amplification.I first tried these with my HTC phone and I was totally disappointed. However, I've had other low cost headphones/earphones that sound bad when hooked up to my phone or another source that can't produce high volumes. So I hooked this up to my home stereo receiver and holy smokes! The bass is awesome and the overall sounds is very good....all for £10. High and mids aren't going to wow you but again, for the low price these things are truly amazing.So if you think they don't sound good with your phone...I dare you to test them out on a good stereo that can produce high volume.

review_bold: Only useful as a stopper for bottles with an opening of less than 18mm. Most standard bottles etc are just over 18mm.
review: This is a nice product, and a lovely idea, but you'll need to measure the diameter of your bottle mouth carefully if you want the cork to grip the inside of the bottle it's intended for - standard wine bottle mouths are three quarters of an inch (19mm diameter).The bottom end of the cork on these measures 16mm, graduating to 18mm - the widest bit of the cork is fixed inside the wooden peg so although the stopper will sit inside a standard bottle, there won't be any grip, and it certainly won't be leakproof or airtight.This gadget will only be useful for stoppering a bottle with an opening of under 18mm - that couple of millimetres really does make all the difference between this product being any real use, or just ending up gathering dust in the clutter drawer.It's a shame the makers couldn't use a cork the next size up, then it'd be great for stoppering wine, oils or vinegars and it'd probably be a five star product.

review: This is an amazing diffuser and I have really enjoyed using it. I have several others but this one is larger and can run longer. The wood grain finish is especially pretty and matches well in the bedroom where I use it. Its nice at night to wake up and have subtle light in the room. Just plug it in, add water and a few drops of your favorite essential oil and your home will smell great. Add more oil for a dinner scent or less for something more subtle. Very easy to use and clean. Just press the button on the front side to set the timer and walk away. The diffuser emits a fine steam that smells amazing. I also like the ability to change the light to different colours or have it change on its own. Exactly as described by the manufacturer. A user-friendly device that is very simple to set up, clean, refill, and operate. One button turns on/off the light, which changes colours and adds ambiance to any room. The vapor function works on a timed cycle that is operated by the push of one button. The aroma begins immediately and provides a very pleasant scent to our large living room-kitchen-dining-office area. It also holds a lot of water and therefore doesn't have to be refilled after one use on the max number of hours. Can't find any fault with this unit. I would definitely recommend this, I hope you have found my review helpful. I would be grateful if you could tick the YES box to say that this review was helpful, many thanks for taking the time to read this.

review_bold: Not bad, one perspective on what caused Dewsburys downfall.
review: Having grown up near Dewsbury (but not living there), I have memories when I was a kid of going to Dewsbury Swimming baths, the market and the shops as a kid, and it being a nice place. The town had all the usual shops, such as Marks and Spencer, and was relatively smart.I knew it had become a run down and the home of Karen Mathews, but took my car to a tyre fitter there a year ago as they had a tyre in stock. Whilst my tyre was being done,I strolled through Dewsbury for the first time in maybe 20 years, and was shocked at what I saw, many of the shops and even McDonalds closed down. I saw a group of drunks fighting in the town square (middle of the day). I was approached by someone who appeared to have serious psychiatric issues. The people looked poor and dejected. Pound stores, ?never never? on the tick type shops and various Asian speciality shops seemed the order of the day. Even the market was a shadow of its former self and I heard just the other week that a famous Pork butchers had shut up shop after around 100 years or more. It was basically horrible, one of the worst towns I had ever walked though. How sad I felt.I saw this book and wondered if it would cast some light on how a once nice town had become this. The rather quick death of the place had sort of passed me by, I would like some answers.The book explains the cultural split in a Dewsbury with people living in alternate universe in places like Saville Town, and the lack of integration between communities. The author seems to think this is a big part of the town?s downfall. He also explains the political climate, and how certain entities ceased control and imposed an agenda, to the detriment of many Dewsbury residents.Im not convinced the book is that well written and sometimes seems rambling and flitting between different subjects. However, it?s a decent read and offers on perspective on the problems Dewsbury most certainly has.
product: The Islamic Republic of Dewsbury
label: CG
review_text: Having grown up near Dewsbury (but not living there), I have memories when I was a kid of going to Dewsbury Swimming baths, the market and the shops as a kid, and it being a nice place. The town had all the usual shops, such as Marks and Spencer, and was relatively smart.I knew it had become a run down and the home of Karen Mathews, but took my car to a tyre fitter there a year ago as they had a tyre in stock. Whilst my tyre was being done,I strolled through Dewsbury for the first time in maybe 20 years, and was shocked at what I saw, many of the shops and even McDonalds closed down. I saw a group of drunks fighting in the town square (middle of the day). I was approached by someone who appeared to have serious psychiatric issues. The people looked poor and dejected. Pound stores, ?never never? on the tick type shops and various Asian speciality shops seemed the order of the day. Even the market was a shadow of its former self and I heard just the other week that a famous Pork butchers had shut up shop after around 100 years or more. It was basically horrible, one of the worst towns I had ever walked though. How sad I felt.I saw this book and wondered if it would cast some light on how a once nice town had become this. The rather quick death of the place had sort of passed me by, I would like some answers.The book explains the cultural split in a Dewsbury with people living in alternate universe in places like Saville Town, and the lack of integration between communities. The author seems to think this is a big part of the town?s downfall. He also explains the political climate, and how certain entities ceased control and imposed an agenda, to the detriment of many Dewsbury residents.Im not convinced the book is that well written and sometimes seems rambling and flitting between different subjects. However, it?s a decent read and offers on perspective on the problems Dewsbury most certainly has.

review: This author's previous two novels were recommended to me by many people but I didn't get on with either of them. I felt her worth persevering with though so was interested to read her latest - it's less than 200 pages so shouldn't be too much of a problem!Actually. I was completely blown away by this book - it's amazing.The first thing that struck me is the gorgeous prose that flows beautifully and almost demands to be read out loud. The narrative moves from dialogue to description seamlessly but there is never any doubt about the context - very clever. I found myself actually becoming breathless at some points in the novel.Half way through the book there is a change of pace which gives a very different (but no less brilliant) feel.I was particularly impressed by the intensity of this novel which must have required such restraint to keep so short.There is a recurring theme of a Van Gogh painting, the colours of which hang over every pageThere are two narrators but none of the irritating flip flopping that many authors use - we get to understand one character who then hands over to another in a perfect way.I may have to go back and try her other novels again

review_bold: Powerful, well made and really comfortable.
review: Well, I've tried head torches with just one lamp and those with 2 lamps, but this is my first time with a Triple lamp! My hobby is vaping and I build my own coils, which is quite detailed work, so it's essential that I have a great light to work with. This unit definitely provides a huge amount of light!As well as the lamp unit, you get a charging cable and 2 x 18650 batteries. You need to top up the charge in those cells before using the light but once done, you're ready to go. Although you are able to charge the batteries while they are in the housing, I advocate using a separate charger because this allows you to constantly monitor any battery deterioration which may go unnoticed if the batteries don't get taken out of the housing. I strongly recommend charging the cells before using the lamp for the first time. Li-Ion batteries naturally lose their charge over time and there's no obvious way to tell when these cells left the production plant. If you decide to carry spare batteries around with you, it is essential that they are safely and adequately protected in a proper storage box You will need one that is capable of holding 4 cells as I'm not aware of 3-cell battery boxes being available anywhere at present.The harness is very comfortable and the strap that passes over the top of the head makes the whole unit feel very secure. At no time did I feel the unit was about to move or slip off. The straps are nice and wide, to remain comfortable for extended periods of time.A really well made and thoughtfully designed head torch that performs extremely well.

review_bold: A different approach to beating cold sores
review: I bought this Lysine because I appeared to be getting a cold sore every month for some reason. I hated continually putting on Zovirax which made my lips very sore. I used the cold sore patches too. In the end I did a little research and discovered that people who suffer from cold sores are often lacking a certain amino acid and that taking Lysine supplements can help. I have tried this ointment for a couple of days on a tingly lip and the tingle went away. I must say the ointment feels lovely on my lips and I have also started taking a Lysine supplement too. No sign of any more cold sores as yet...

review_bold: Good Jacket Just Get The Larger Size.
review: Overall a pretty good jacket. It appears to be well made and the seams look to be strong enough. It has a nice collar that comes up to the middle of my neck and has two poppers to give either a close or looser fit. It uses velcro to do it up from top to bottom with poppers through the actual velcro. This makes it a touch awkward to align the poppers up if you do not put it together correctly but this is a very minor niggle. I would have preferred the velcro and poppers to be seperate. I was wearing it for a few hours at a time over 2 days and found it to be comfortable and did not notice it once it was on. I am a 42" chest and got an XXL size which is a little too large and I do mean only a little too large but this does mean I can put a jumper on in the winter if needed. I was expecting an XXL to swamp me but it did not so the sizing seems a touch out. I would advise you to err on the side of the larger size. It does have 2 tabs at the rear with poppers to make the waist smaller. The arm length is good as it comes to just past my wrists so fits inside my gauntlets. Overall I am very pleased with it.

review_bold: GREAT bass response, comfortable and lightweight!
review: These sound great, period. I hate the hard plastic buds that came with my iPhone. I have a small ear canal and need buds with silicon ends that fit snugly into my ear. My old Samsun Galaxy S4 buds sounded GREAT, but they started getting crackly and the left ear went out after about 3 months of almost daily use. I didn't trust the "Samsung" earbuds on here, too many fakes and imitations. I saw these were top rated with over 35k reviews. I have to agree, these sound exactly like what I was looking for. They have soft tips with three different sizes, the bass response is EXCELLENT, and they weigh next to nothing. Plus the blue version was only £10.10. Perfect.

review: Pebeo products really are the best for crafts such as glass painting. The Prisme range create interesting effects on their own, but when you combine them with the Vitrail range, you can get a huge range of effects. The Prisme range are opaque, so are not ideal for glass painting where you intend to illuminate the object from behind, such as a votive holder or something to hang in the window, but when combined with the transparent Vitrail products you can get the best of both worlds. The basic Prisme effect reminds me of looking at cells through a microscope. Tiny circles form around the "seed" particles in the paint - the thickness of the layer of paint appears to affect the size of these circles.One small point - when it says "Stir well before use" it means it! The stuff in the paint that acts as the "seed" for the effect needs to be distributed well, otherwise you'll get some early work that has loads of the little "blobs" and your later work will have fewer and fewer.As for the Discovery collections from Pebeo, I'd recommend them every time if you want to try out a new range. You get a good selection of colours for a very reasonable price and, for most hobbyists, the bottles last for a good time. When you start running out, you'll also have a very good idea of which individual, larger bottles would be the best bet.

review_bold: A couple of irritations when using but the product is good in other ways
review: I've never had a Braun iron before so was interested in this one.It arrives packaged with the ironing plate well protected. I'm never happy with too much packaging and there isn't much here but it's not very well designed so that the iron was rattling about a bit in the box - not enough to be damaged though.Without reading the instructions the product looks very intuitive and familiar. The instructions though are very good - written in many languages but with a great visual section which covers all the functions of the iron.There is a self clean function but it is clumsy and I have seen much better options on other irons when you just press a button. Here you have to release a part which then tends to spring out.The lid for the water tank doesn't sit very well and needs to be pushed quite firmly to shut it.Steam function is good and the plate for the actual ironing is very smooth - it has a curved surface at the back which sounds great but I found I didn't really notice it when using the product.The most irritating part of using the iron is when you put it on its heel as the cable gets in the way. The place that the cable comes into the iron needs to be flexible and this iron doesn't have as much movement as other irons which makes it a bit awkward to use.Plenty of volume for the water in the tank and it seemed to last for a long time. I tended to iron with a high temperature and a low steam level which worked very well for most clothes.There is a button on the top which operates the water spray and I kept pressing this by mistake when just holding the iron which was a bit annoying.
