review: This is a pretty expensive router but it seems cheap for what you get if you see what I mean? It really is an excellent router. Build quality is first class and it works much faster than an older Linksys router I had. I don't have it connected to my direct broadband I connect it as an extender to my BT Home Hub and then route all my devices through this. It handles a multitude of different things with no issues. Currently in our household we have 5 iPads, 4 mobile phone, a bunch of smart home and smart TV equipment plus PC's and Laptops and so far I have not had to reboot it once. Set up is easy and there is an app available for controlling it (I use iOS). All in all this is a very well specked router that is working very well for my requirements. I am vey pleased with it and cannot see me swapping it out any time soon. Well done Linksys.

review_bold: Good value, turns yellowish after about 9-12 months [updated]
review: Good value but it has turned yellowish after about 1yr of usage. Still fits nicely though and the phone gets taken in and out on a regular basis to switch between SIM card of different countries. So holds its form which is a big plus on this kind of soft case.3-stars mostly because of the discoloration as it makes my girlfriends white iPhone 5S look older than it is.Edit 25/02/2015: Anker has read my review and offered me to either receive another case (of another color) or get a refund. I often for the ladder since we sold that iPhone 5 a few weeks ago. I gave the review an extra star: 3 for the product + 1 for the service. It doesn't happen very often that a company proactively contacts you to resolve an issue so I believe this should be reflected in my overall review even though the product, of that particular color, has some deficiencies. Thanks Anker, I'll reward your excellent service with my continued loyalty!

review: Love the original Ratchet and Clank trilogy and the PS3 "full games", all of which I have played to the end. Some R&C games, however, switch from the camera following Ratchet's movements to the stupid "camera looks the direction you point it to look" system. If you turn and run, you have to use the other "joystick" - it's probably got some other name these days - to actually look in the direction you're physically travelling in. It's no big problem if you're used to those major shoot-em-up games, but if you're a casual gamer like me, this separate camera control makes absolutely no sense whatsoever.I gave up at the stage where you had to jump from one magnetic walkway to another under severe time constraints - you had to look where you wanted to jump, using that second joystick to look. Totally unintuitive to my brain, and it made the game too frustrating for words.

review: This is not the Batman of later years, vastly experienced and ready for anything. This is a younger, rawer character who quite often gets beaten but always finds a way back. The animation is fantastic, the reworking of some characters really works (although as previously written not Joker) and it is very watchable. Batman is such a varied character that there is plenty of room for different interpretations and I think this is a good one. Accessible enough for my two kids to enjoy with enough depth and entertainment to keep me sitting there as well.

review_bold: Works out of the box on Xubuntu 16.04 Linux (an Ubuntu flavour), may require molex power
review: (Note: several products here listed as different variants - this is regarding the 2-port PCIe USB 3.0 controller with the NEC chipset.)This works out of the box for me on Xubuntu 16.04, and so I expect it will work well on other recent Ubuntu flavours and modern Linux distributions generally. With sustained writing to my USB 3 external hard drive I get about 140MB/s (bytes not bits) compared to about 28MB/s for the existing USB 2 ports on my machine - so a significant improvement which is enough for my purposes though rather less than the theoretical maximum of USB 3.0 (but don't know whether the card is actually the bottle-neck).It has a 4-pin molex connector for power - I don't know if this is actually required to power USB 2 compatible devices or not as I haven't tried running without it connected. Currently I'm powering it with a SATA power to molex adapter and this seems to be ok.
product: CSL USB 3.0 PCI express (PCIe) controller | 2 x external (ports) / 1 x internal (controller/header) | USB 3.0 Super Speed interface card | USB internal hub
label: CG
review_text: (Note: several products here listed as different variants - this is regarding the 2-port PCIe USB 3.0 controller with the NEC chipset.)This works out of the box for me on Xubuntu 16.04, and so I expect it will work well on other recent Ubuntu flavours and modern Linux distributions generally. With sustained writing to my USB 3 external hard drive I get about 140MB/s (bytes not bits) compared to about 28MB/s for the existing USB 2 ports on my machine - so a significant improvement which is enough for my purposes though rather less than the theoretical maximum of USB 3.0 (but don't know whether the card is actually the bottle-neck).It has a 4-pin molex connector for power - I don't know if this is actually required to power USB 2 compatible devices or not as I haven't tried running without it connected. Currently I'm powering it with a SATA power to molex adapter and this seems to be ok.

review_bold: Perfect for sketching and watercolouring on the move
review: Water brush pens are great for art journalling on the move. With these three pens, my Winsor & Newton Cotman Water Colour Paints - 12 Half Pans and Moleskine sketchbook I can quickly sketch and wash on the move.If you've not used them before, the bottom half of the brush can be filled with water and gently squeezing sends water through to the bristles. If you need to change colour then simply squeeze water through and wipe to clean. Obviously there is a limit to the amount of water that each pen can hold so you may have to take a separate water source for refilling if you have a large surface to cover or do a lot of different sketches.

review_bold: Clear, simple, long battery, perfect for long rides on the bike
review: I liked this so much I bought another for my wife. I use this all the time out on the bike. It is great for recording the rides but also viewing afterwards on Garmin Connect. I have also drawn routes on the web map, uploaded to the device and used them as route to follow. We did London to Paris like that and it was spot on. The battery will last all day which was something I found essential. Friends have map versions but could not get 8 hours of life out of their units. This is small enough to be light but the display gives me all the information I want. This is simple and clear without all the bells and whistles. If you want cadence, power etc. go for something else.

I have to say that the quality had gone down compare to the ones made 10yrs ago (so i gave four stars instead of five). But the pen is still cheap, light and it works well. I have very small handwriting so most european fountain pens sold at the lower end are too broad for me, this pen is fine enough and it looks vintage. It is true that this one is no where near the original parker, but for intensive essay writing, cheap and durable is just right.

review: The observation of youth culture is not a topic I would normally read about and many novels tackling this subject would tend to be marketed as YA novels. However, this book was highly recommended as a book which should be read by all people so I was curious.It's almost 300 pages split into 39 chapters.Gang culture doesn't touch my life on a day to day basis so it is easy to dismiss it as nothing but a curse to society, however anyone who is prepared to invest time in a book like this is looking for so much more and the author gives us that.It is clear that Polly Courtney has researched the world she is using and she appears to get into the minds of the various gang members involved in the story.Initially it's difficult to get used to the authentic language that is used but the glossary at the front really helps - within a few chapters I felt quite at ease with the dialogue. This makes the story feel very real as you manage to get into Alesha's head and start to understand her distrust of the unknown. I really got a feel for the immediate way that she runs her life with no thought for the future.The process of reading this book is hard as it forces you to challenge your own opinions of Alesha. We see how she makes her decisions about what is the truth and how she applies her prejudice to her judgements. The difficult part for the reader is to think about what you would do, given her background and her limited access to resources.Her teacher edges towards being a cliche but she is used well and serves an important role in the plot in providing an alternative view for Alesha to considerIt's very hard for most people to sympathise with those involved in gang culture - this book does not judge the gang members but tries to understand, which is the best that all of us can do. I found myself becoming angry and frustrated by her life which shows how strong the character was to me.To read this book then you'll have to have a curiosity about gang culture and, if you have, then you'll find this book fascinating and very rewarding. I hope that this novel will make you question your beliefs as it did with me.

This makes the story feel very real as you manage to get into Alesha's head and start to understand her distrust of the unknown. review: I use earbuds 16 hours per day with a hearing aid so what I want to hear is much different from that of music listeners. What I look for is a clear reproduction of the human voice, most earbuds fail in this area, they boost the lows or otherwise distort to satisfy music listeners. After using earbuds for 15 years the these earbuds are the best I have found for faithful reproduction and they are also the most comfortable.

review_bold: Beautiful artwork on high quality board. Much more than just a 'greetings' card.
review: Lovely set of eight cards on high quality board, each measuring 6.25" square, with white envelopes in a strong cellophane pack. 50p per pack donated to the Stroke Association.Artwork on these is by S.R.Badmin - snowy winter fields, woods and distant images of people tobogganing down a snowy hillside. but the magic in the imagery is in the cold, blue outlines of billowing clouds and timeless landscape. I particularly love the depiction of the wary hare in the bottom left hand corner, the starkness of the dormant, snow laden treescape, softened by shadows and light, and the almost Lowry-esque late arrivals to the afternoon's fun.This is a card that tells a story as much as sends a greeting.Wording inside is a simple, secular "Season's Greetings" in gentle script.Beautiful card, and a worthy Charity, of which there is a little more info on the back.

review: This was an excellent purchase. The headphones come with extra tips in case you have large or very small ear canals (or have different sized ear canals like me). The sound quality was excellent for the price. I had good highs, midranges, and bass. The bass isn't going to blow you away if you're used to the overly strong bass on entry-level headphones, but I would say that it doesn't matter because you are instead getting fairly accurate audio. The only thing these are really missing are an inline mic and some controls, but at this price, I'm not complaining.

review_bold: Distinctly feminine Christmas gift bags, ideal for small gifts, tasteful colours and decorations. Sturdy and well-made.
review: This pack of four Christmas gift bags has a distinctively feminine tone, with three of the four bags featuring floral decorations. The fourth and smallest bag features a Morris Minor piled with presents. Unisex, but barely big enough to hold a bottle of aftershave. All the bags are very sturdy and well-made, with well-attached sturdy card tags, that won't come off easily.These aren't large bags - the largest won't hold anything much bigger than a medium-sized box of chocolates.If you loathe wrapping, then these are probably a good little investment for small gifts like perfume and aftershaves, or something awkwardly shaped that isn't too large.The designs are very tasteful, and the colours suitably festive without being gaudy. If you are fed up of tinsel, glitter and metallic colours, then these should suit you.

review: This is the best food for dogs I have experienced. I had never heard of this make before testing this. I have bought Lily's Kitchen for my dogs but they did not like it so reverted back to their normal food which is pretty good. This dog food is a hundred times better. Cas near to fresh as you can get in a tin.I have two really finicky eaters and it is a nightmare most days to get them to eat. As soon as I opened a Tim of this they were waiting by my side for their dinner. I mixed it with their kibble and they devoured it in in minutes. No adverse effects either, I was a bit worried that they might have an upset tummy due to the change in diet but they are fine.Very expensive but worth every penny if you can afford it. I will re-buy but alternate it with their other food and give them this every few days as a lovely treat for them. Absolutely recommend if cost is not a major factor and you want the best for your dogs.

label: CG
review_text: This is the best food for dogs I have experienced. I had never heard of this make before testing this. I have bought Lily's Kitchen for my dogs but they did not like it so reverted back to their normal food which is pretty good. This dog food is a hundred times better. Cas near to fresh as you can get in a tin.I have two really finicky eaters and it is a nightmare most days to get them to eat. As soon as I opened a Tim of this they were waiting by my side for their dinner. I mixed it with their kibble and they devoured it in in minutes. No adverse effects either, I was a bit worried that they might have an upset tummy due to the change in diet but they are fine.Very expensive but worth every penny if you can afford it. I will re-buy but alternate it with their other food and give them this every few days as a lovely treat for them. Absolutely recommend if cost is not a major factor and you want the best for your dogs.

review: The Aoafun kick mats look and feel well made, they are a little thinner than I was expecting but they do their job.The kick mats have two adjustable straps, one at the top of the kick mat to go around the seats head rest and the other strap at the bottom of the kick mat that wraps around the bottom of the car seat.I'm using the kick mats on a Kia Venga with the kick mats fitting well and I can easily conceal the bottom strap by pushing it into the seat.The kick mats have a selection of different sized pockets with a large pocket at the bottom of the kick mat being able to be closed by a Velcro strip.Thank you for taking the time to read my review, I hope it has helped in some way.If this review has helped in any way, in a positive or negative way please click the yes or no button below.

review_bold: Good solid performer that is safe to use.
review: What I like most about this is that it's safe. First, it has a proper UK plug on it, and second, the rotating blade is never exposed. It only runs when the cup is locked into the machine, totally surrounding the blade. That makes it far better than other slushy makers that I've looked at.After that, all I can say is that it does the job. There's two blades, one for just cutting up fruit and vegetables and beans and lentils, and the other is a stronger serrated one for when you're crushing ice. You simply can't go wrong in using it. The other thing I like is that it's very easy to clean. Each of the parts in contact with food (cup/jug, blade, lid and seal) can be removed and rinsed or washed. The other parts don't get dirty at all. It makes about three quarters of a litre of slush/soup/whatever, and is a reasonable size for putting away in the drawer. I like it.

review_bold: Ideal way to strenghthen fingers and forearms
review: These bands are made to strengthen the muscles in your hand. They come in 3 different colours and each colour has a higher resistance.There is PINK which has light resistance and works better for people who have injured hands and for people who are just starting to use the hand bands. The pink bands are very easy to use. They feel very squishy almost like a slimeball.The GREEN is medium resistance and is for excersing your hand every day. It not so soft as the pink one but still has a good stretch.The BLUE one has high resistance and is for advanced muscle tones. It had the hardest stretch of all. You can really feel your muscles in your are while pulling it.They are not like your traditional hand bands. The old ones are easy snap and can sometimes be hard to put on because of the hard rubber. The #FITMOTION hand bands do not snap and are really easy to put on.

review: I'm very pleased with this box. It's small and quiet and reasonably priced. It's much quieter than last one I bought (which is still working fine). It doesn't cost much more than a USB or eSATA drive and a NAS drive is much more flexible. It would be nice if you could add more drives to the box but I can't really expect this for the price! I haven't tested the Bittorrent client so I can't review this.I agree with other reviewers that the power management could be improved. It hasn't changed in years. Why not have an standby mode when the device is idle?They still bundle Memeo Autobackup with the drive which I don't recommend. It has improved over the years but still has some major drawbacks.

review_bold: A worthy Topfield replacement. Just a daft remote button placement spoils it a bit...plus one other issue!
review: Needed to replace my beloved Topfield that had suddenly gone cranky. Saw these for £88 and went for it. Glad I did! The unit appeared to be brand new and unused. Not a single mark on it anywhere, well done if it was used! Setup was fine and I didnt bother with the online stuff as I have a FireTV box for all that. Handy to have a SCART too as I have just one HDMI on my old TV so extra points there. Works just as well if not better than my Topfield. However, there is one major annoyance. The remote has a really bad design flaw. The up/down/left right buttons are in a small ring set inside another ring surrounded underneath by the 'back' button. If you are a millimetre out you press back instead of down. How that got through usability testing I'll never know. One star knocked off for that. Anyway other than that, it was a superb bargain. As for the Topfield turns out the TAPS had just got messed up. Not surprising as I hadn't updated them for 4+ years. A quick factory reset and its working again. Handy to have a backup.Update July 2106. - Okay having had this box a few months we have noticed our TV viewing has nosedived.The reason? I mentioned to my other half that I wasn't watching as much TV due to to the TV guide not giving an instant synopsis of the program highlighted like my old Topfield did. She remarked that she had been thinking the same thing. If you want a synopsis, you have to manually select the info using the fiddly remote. It's a tiny thing but it has put us off watching Freeview TV, so we now use the FireTV/Prime/Netflix for 90% of TV viewing. With the Topfield I would go through the guide and instantly see anything that peaked my interest and set it to record, job done. Amazing how one lacking feature can spoil it.
product: BT Youview+ Set Top Box (500Gb) Recorder with Twin HD Freeview and 7 Day Catch Up TV - no subscription (Certified Refurbished)

review: I have had this Matcc pet car seat cover for around a week now and so far I am very happy and impressed with it.I got this pet seat cover to replace another older pet car seat cover that was getting a little tatty.While the old pet seat cover just covered the top and back of the rear car seats this Matcc seat cover also covers the sides of the rear seat and the front of the rear seat or the cover can be attached to the front seats to form like a hammock shape between the rear and front seats.The seat cover looks well made and has adjustable straps to attach the cover to the rear and front seat head rests.It has two Velcro openings in the cover so the seat belt buckles can be passed through them.The cover also has an adjustable restraining strap attached to the right side of it. ( Driver's side ). To stop your dog moving around to much in the back of the car.So far as mentioned above I have had this cover for around a week and have had no problems with it, like it moving around and coming away from the seat even though I?m using it with a fairly large dog.ConclusionWell made pet car seat cover.So far I have had no problems with it and would recommend it.Thank you for taking the time to read my review, I hope it has helped in some way.If this review has helped in any way, in a positive or negative way please click the yes or no button below.

review: The good:* Decent print quality.* Decent speed.* Reasonably quiet.* Wireless capability.* Low price.* Quite compact (though the effective footprint increases when you load a stack of paper into the feeder and open the output tray hinge).* Cheap third party toner carts available.The bad:* Official toner carts are super-expensive.* Can be tricky to set up - in my opinion you need to be quite technical if you want to use the wireless as the setup process seems prone to glitches. (Not an issue if you just use USB.)* The 'cloud print' feature is completely broken. Printouts sent via HP's ePrint system take an age (typically 4-5 minutes) before there is any output, if they even print as quite often cloud print jobs just disappear into the aether. Since the 'Google Cloud Print' capability simply piggybacks on ePrint, this also suffers the same woes with the added complication of another layer of complexity.Luckily, if you are an Android owner at least, you have a solution (though you have to pay for it). There is an app called 'Printer Share' which actually is capable of talking directly to the printer over WiFi, with its own drivers, completely bypassing the hopelessly flawed ePrint. This produces near immediate output 100% of the time. The drawback is that this is a paid app - IIRC about 7 or 8 pounds. I think it's also available for iOS but I've only used it on Android - however, I'd expect it to be equally good on that platform.HP really should license it and give a free copy with the printer as without it, a large part of the the selling point of the printer is gone.

Overall satisfied with my purchase and would definitely recommend.

review_bold: Large = men's medium. Go a size up, reasonably well-made and very good value if they fit.
review: Caution, these are unisex, but only if you are a man with medium sized hands, or a female with not too large hands, a 'small large'.. They are leather, they are reasonably well made, but they aren't that large at all. I have just bought a wheelchair for very occasional use, I'm just as likely to use these for cycling.The good point about them is that they leave the fingers and thumb free for smartphone operation, handling coins and all the hundred and one tasks that are so much harder with full-finger gloves.I'm happy enough with them, but if you usually take a large in gloves, and are male, don't expect these to fit.At the time of writing this review, they are available for an incredible price, and very good value.

review_bold: Good, fresh Vietnamese Cashews. Well produced, well graded and packaged.
review: Good, clean, well produced Cashews. No spoiled or bruised ones, very few broken, none with any signs of insect damage, no debris, skin or teste. Taste delicious - firm, sweet and creamy. These are good, fresh Cashews, nothing added.These are a decent standard size, not jumbo but that's fine for me - they're premium cashews but at a reasonable price for a good product.I like that they're not roasted or salted, haven't had anything done to them, so are perfect for snacking as well as cooking.Pleased with this order. Country of origin (Vietnam) stated, plus Batch Number and BB date, which is long - bought in November '17 these have a long date until October 2019, so they're good, fresh Cashews.

review_bold: Good flavour, vaper production and value for money.
review: For those wanting to quit cigarettes, I feel this is a pretty good starter kit. It's well made and the Tank performs really well, considering its size. I've had mine a couple of weeks now and I'm still on the coil supplied pre-installed in the device. Airflow is good and flavour and vapour production more than adequate for even a formerly heavy smoker.I've had zero leaking issues, nor have I suffered any 'dry-hits'. The top-fill system works really well although I strongly recommend that you close off the airflow control ring completely before removing the top-cap to fill the Tank. It's also important to prime the coil and make sure that the wicking material is fully saturated before firing-up the coil for the first time. I have been using a 60/40 VG/PG e-liquid.Battery life is good for the size of the device and as the USB charging port is on the side, there's no need to lay the unit on its side to charge it as is the case when the charging port is situated on the base.Although I appreciate the need for safety features being built into devices, especially when used by less experienced vapers, I am not a fan of the way this device automatically turns off if it's not used for around 10 minutes. However, it's easy enough to turn the unit back on again with 5 rapid clicks of the Fire Button and because of the market this product is designed to satisfy, I'm not going to deduct any stars for this.

review: Waited a long time for GT5 and.............its a bit bland and a a bit boring. The vehicle physics do not provide enough feedback, as in previous installments the race series do not provide enough AI making it all too easy.The new cape ring track is dull, there are not enough cars (too many duplicates of JDM cars). License progression is pointless, B spec is unneccesary, the rally sims are aweful - the feedback from the loose surfaces is non existant with zero progression.As a stand alone driving sim it is OK, as a race environment it isn't. Perhaps the GT4 time trials should have been kept to remove the AI issue, drop the B spec, add a few more RM car derivatives, develop a more realistic braking and wheel slip algorithm.Viewing it through my eyes as a race driver and vehicle engineer it doesn't come anywhere near living up to the hype, as a gamer it is worth having, it is entertaining but it doesn't grab you and force you to keep driving

review_bold: Beautifully packaged, really strongly scented hand cream. A top--quality cream that leaves hands cared for and perfumed.
review: Gorgeous, a beautifully packaged hand cream that would make a lovely gift, or sit elegantly in the bathroom at home. The cream is presented in a sturdy sleeved box with the iconic Morris Strawberry Thief design in silver, both on the box, and on the tube. The print on the tube has a slightly textured finish, making it easy to grip with damp hands, I also liked the fact that the cream could be stood on its cap with no problems. I liked the scent of this,which was just as well, as it's really strong. I couldn't detect any scent of salt, I did wonder if this meant the cream had a gritty texture, on reading the description, but no, it's beautifully smooth and rich. It rubs in quickly with no hint of stickiness or oiliness, just a strong residual scent.This is a bit too special to keep in the kitchen, and put on your hands after doing the dishes. I wouldn't recommend using this before preparing food, as I would be concerned about the perfume from the cream tainting food, but that's its only minus point.An upmarket stockingfiller gift, beautifully packaged, that looks really classy.

review: This is an absolute lifesaver if you are a heavy phone user. I am getting approx 120% extra out of my iphone 5. I can now go from 7am to Midnight without doing the smartphone power panic. I am an extremely heavy phone user and work very long hours. I use my phone for work and while a basic nokia would do for the calls and i could use an ipad for my emails, it is just not practical to carry 2 devices. I spend approx 180 minutes a day on calls and I receive all my work via emailed Pdf documents and an online web portal so I probably spend maybe 90 minutes actively on cellular data every day too (approx 250mb a day) plus the usual googling for phone numbers/ downloading podcasts/ sending emails. I dont have wifi access during the day at all as I am on the road and between customer locations. I switch the battery on when i reach 20% on my iphone and switch it off when i hit 90% charge, then i repeat when it hits 20% again and usually get to somewhere between 70% and 75% when the case stops charging. for me this is enough to see me through the longest, busiest days. On my iphone 4 i had a mophie juice pack plus and while it was good for the short time it worked, the micro usb port broke off the circuit board after about a month and the retailer i bought it from wouldnt give me warranty as i did not have the original receipt so I swore i would never buy mophie product again. I have the Anker battery case about 6 weeks now and I am so impressed. I no longer have to carry around an ac adapter and lightning cable everywhere I go. that alone is worth the trade off in terms of the extra bulk of the case.

review: This is my review of : Heiyo TENS Machine Pulse Massager (4 Pads),Portable Muscle Stimulators for Health Promotion and Physical Therapy?Relaxation of Muscle Spasms?Pain Relief ?Joint Pain?Back Injury?Ankle Break-Pearl WhiteI have suffered with chronic back pain for years so thought it was about time i tried one of these devices out.First thing to note about this tens machine is its incredibly small size being just under 4cm square which is not that much bigger than a 2 pound coin its so small it can be taken with you wherever you go without anyone realising you have it with you.After unboxing this device you will need to install the controller app to your smartphone which you will find on your appstore it is called qeasy and available for both android and ios.You will also need to install the supplied battery into the device,you do this by prying the small round battery cover off the back of the device and inserting the battery then replacing the cover.Please note that you do not need to undo the small screw next to the battery cover.You will also need to fit the sticky electro pads to the leads they just need to be pushed on then the leads attach to the device via a magnetic plug.Once you have used the pads they may be washed in plain water and left to dry before replacing them onto there blue film covers,the pads should be ok for around 50 uses before they need replacing.This device has 7 different treatment modes and is very easy to use via the app that you need to download to your smartphone ( either ios or android whichever you have )You can choose from massage, cupping, acupuncture, peening, knocking, scrapping and finally a mix of all modes you also have 7 different levels of intensity to choose from as well as being able to set a timer to your desired length of treatment.Packaging List1 X Pulse Massage4 X Electrodes Pads1 X Button Battery1 X Neck Rope1 X User ManualI suffer a lot of pain in the lower part of my back. I did find however that using this device did help me to ease the pain I have been experiencing. i would also recommend that anyone using this device should start on a lower setting and work your way up to the higher settings as it can be quite powerful at its maximum setting.Overall this is an excellent device that is truly portable for use anywhere at anytime and at this price is definatley worth trying if you suffer from aches and pains.If you found my review helpful please click on the YES button. Thanks

review_bold: Haven't tried it on a plane yet, but very impressed with quality
review: I have struggled on long haul flights for years. Last year I bought a supposed new design of travel pillow that is long and thin and you sling it around you like a guitar. Both my wife and I were unimpressed, and that one was expensive.So I thought I'd try this different approach. The problem is there is usually no room or the angle is not right to have your head back. This one tries to solve that problem and means you put it on the table and lean forward into it.It comes in a little bag. It is as good quality material as the expensive long one I bought , in fact material seems to be exactly the same. The valve is also pretty good and despite the size of the pillow, I blew it up very easily.Testing it out at home, leaning forward and placing your head through a hole certainly seems comfortable, and if I can sleep like this then it will solve the problem of hurting neck as you try to get your head back with a traditional pillow.I'm off the New York in a month and I will use this on the flight and report back after that field test. However in terms of design and materials, and the idea and my at home test, this is 5 star so far.
product: Travel Pillow, WENFENG Portable Inflatable Pillows, Sleep Pillow for Airplane, Tranins, Office, Soft PVC Flocking Large Neck Pillow Support Full Body and Head, (Grey)
label: CG
review_text: I have struggled on long haul flights for years. Last year I bought a supposed new design of travel pillow that is long and thin and you sling it around you like a guitar. Both my wife and I were unimpressed, and that one was expensive.So I thought I'd try this different approach. The problem is there is usually no room or the angle is not right to have your head back. This one tries to solve that problem and means you put it on the table and lean forward into it.It comes in a little bag. It is as good quality material as the expensive long one I bought , in fact material seems to be exactly the same. The valve is also pretty good and despite the size of the pillow, I blew it up very easily.Testing it out at home, leaning forward and placing your head through a hole certainly seems comfortable, and if I can sleep like this then it will solve the problem of hurting neck as you try to get your head back with a traditional pillow.I'm off the New York in a month and I will use this on the flight and report back after that field test. However in terms of design and materials, and the idea and my at home test, this is 5 star so far.

review_bold: Great Quality, Genuine Elemi Essential Oil.
review: This is lovely quality - Elemi has loads of uses as an anti-inflammatory, gently antiseptic oil with a slightly spicy, frankincense like fragrance. It's mainly used in expensive cosmetics - I use a few drops in rosehip seed oil for facial use or added to a moisturiser for all over - it's soothing and healing, smells and feels lovely, sinks in with no oily residue.Good too, blended with Styrax Benzoin in a bit of my Calendula oil for repairing chafed skin and healing moisture lesions.A mix of Elemi, Benzoin and Eucalyptus in a vapouriser or as an inhalant is a specific for head colds or respiratory virus infections as well as smelling lovely, suitable for all ages.Elemi is superb all year round, but it's one of my absolute essential for winter use.This is a really well sourced E.O. from a reputable company and it's one of the best.

review_bold: A great book to keep you amused for a few minutes a day
review: I am a big fan of bits and pieces of useless information, so for years have enjoyed books full of the stuff. This book is therefore currently at the top of my reading list when I have a few minutes sat down with not much else to entertain me. Each page has a selection of short anecdotes, facts or stories related to food. Most of them are one or two sentences long, and almost all of them are eyebrow raisers.Reading it in one go is not recommended as fact overload sets on very quickly, but to pick up and put down a couple of times a day this is a great book.

review: I purchased these after reading the great review on businessinsider.com, and am blown away by the sound on these! These earbuds punch way above their weight class. Plugged them into my Ipad mini, and played a variety of musical genres thru them, and am very impressed by the tight sound across the spectrum. The bass is solid, but not too overbearing, the mids are clear, especially vocals, and highs are very defined. Cymbal hits ring out as if you are right at the venue! I put these up against some Skullcandy earbuds that I paid 19.99 for, and they far outperformed them. Am going to get another pair of these just in case these decided to discontinue these things (which I doubt). Comes with three sets of earbud pads (small, medium and large) to accommodate all ear canal sizes. The design looks to be sturdy, hope that they will last a good while. In summary, these are a great value, and sonically, are pure gold, will be hard pressed to find anything in this price range that even sounds remotely as good as these earbuds.

review: This is a heavy duty case but it isn't a heavy case.I have a daughter who has reached the age that she's all arms and elbows and awkward clumsy moments.This means that the iPad has been dropped and bumped and jarred around. In fact, one iPad has been dropped and fixed so many times it finally just had to be replaced. So we thought we'd try this case instead.This case was easy to install on the iPad. Additionally, once it is on, it stays on. This means the iPad isn't slipping out of the case to fall on the floor, nor is it slipping around in the case. It fits well.The holes in the case align perfectly and we have had no problem using headphones or charging the iPad with the case on.One of the bonus parts of this case is the built-in screen protector. That was a plus for us since it meant only one item to protect it all. The screen did not have the rainbow view I've read about so that is nice.Great product. Would recommend it.

review: These are my favorite headphones I ever had. Whenever I run, I always listen to music. Also, I always had problems with getting the right headphones for myself without spending too much money. I tried a few different ones that weren't too expensive, and for some reason, after a certain running distance my ears would slightly hurt and feel uncomfortable. With these headphones, I don't have that problem anymore. Now, I can listen to the music while running as long as I want to. In fact, I wasn't the only one who liked them. My brother also liked them a lot so he decided to "borrow" my headphones. As he didn't want to give them back, I ordered two more for myself (just in case someone will "borrow" them again).

review: Another entertaining, well-written book about the life of Greg Heffley through his phases of Middle School; this time we get to experience his journey and thoughts through puberty and witness another falling out with his best friend Rowley among other things.My daughter had lots of laughs reading this edition of the popular ongoing series written by Jeff Kinney. She finished reading it in one day since she found it so entertaining- I couldn?t get her to put it down.Every new book that has been published has never failed to impress and kept the high standards the previous books had set. It?s certainly worth the read and very addictive since my daughter can?t stop reading them.

review: Have only had these a few days, but so far these are excellent. Got them to replace an old set of Sony earbuds that died from the cable being bent the wrong way a few too many times.Really impressed with two things right away:1) Comfort and fit are excellent. These have a kind of 'offset' design so it actually sits in your ear correctly and doesn't put pressure on anything unnecessarily2) Sound quality is on point (as others have mentioned). I'm no audiophile, but I've tested a few different types of song and I didn't really notice anything lacking in a particular range.Basically, these are probably way better than they should be for the price.

review_bold: Nicely finished and presented comprehensive nail care kit.
review: As you can see from the pictures on the webpage, this is a very comprehensive nail care kit. It also comes in a very nice case that provides excellent protection. For the price, you certainly get a lot for your money.Clearly, there is only so much wear you can inflict on a product like this in a relatively short time, so it's impossible to predict the longevity of the tools that are designed for clipping, cutting or filing as only time will tell how well they stand-up to use. However, straight out of the case, everything is really sharp and gives very clean cuts, leaving no burrs or roughness on the cut nail.I have inspected the cutting edges using a magnifying glass and I can't see any initial wear or any indication that these edges will degrade quickly. This is clearly a comprehensive set of tools for personal, home use but I wouldn't go as far as to say they would be suitable for use in a commercial environment.This is a really good gift idea for a "Her" or a "Him". If I suffer any premature failure, I will update this review accordingly.

review_bold: Multipurpose baggies, good size, well designed.
review: Bought the multipack of five - small softgrip overlay panels texturise the polyester (which feels similar to good swimwear fabric), inner has a soft nap surface which affords some protection as well as a polishing cloth. Bigger than I thought, these multipurpose drawstring baggies measure 7.5" x 5" there or thereabouts, they're very light and strong, well made, no faults in the machining or the fabric.I originally got these as keepers for my cheapo 'ready readers' specs, but they surprised me by being big enough to comfortably hold and protect some oversized sunnies and my night driving glasses that I keep in the car as well.Drawstring baggie means that I can fix them up near to hand and don't have to grope around trying to find them while I'm driving. Bonus.Different colourways on the baggie helps differentiate the respective contents.These are big enough for all sorts of items you want to stash, from specs and small valuables such as watches or keys, to mobile phones and change for the car park. They're a good idea. Glad I got them.If they get grubby, they clean up well with just a quick swizz in water and they're dry in no time.

review: I buy a lot of cheap, in-ear, headphones. There are four of us in the family that use them for iPods, laptops, iPads, etc., so we tend to go through them fairly quickly. I have used about 5 or 6 different brands including Sony and Skullcandy but don't recall the other ones. These are easily the best sounding and fitting I have ever used. I will be buying these exclusively from now on and highly recommend them. At this price point you aren't likely to ever find audiophile quality sound but these do a fine job of rendering midrange sound without any annoying tinny treble. Bass is far better than most pairs I have used but still a little lacking.

review: For sticking bit's of paper together I tend to use a glue stick. However, when it came to gluing my daughters' school project, the much trusted glue stick, well wasn't up to the job. It did not provide adequate adhesion and strength of the glue was also a factor. The material in question was cardboard and various fabrics.After much reading, I came across 3-in-1 Advanced craft Glue. This is a versatile glue which can be used on all sorts and grades of paper (within reason) and works well on fabric too.On my daughters boot, there was a rip in the fabric (PVC I think) which I tried to repair using the glue. The glue is transparent so not very visible and could be used on fabrics and other delicate materials. There is no smell too. The glue sets fast and is tacky which can leave a trail behind if you are not careful.If the product is unworthy of a good review, I think it is unfair to leave positive feedback as this can mislead potential buyers. I hope you found the review helpful. Please click on the ?Yes? button below.

review: These are legit amazing.The price point is great. The durability is excellent. The comfort is unparalleled.I can't comment on the sound as compared to other earbuds because prior to buying these, I'd been unable to use earbuds for the previous two decades. Everything just _hurt_ my ear canals. I have left these in overnight, on long plane flights, and for hours of study / gaming time with absolutely no discomfort. I was even pleasantly surprised to find the medium sized buds fit my ears best, which means that somewhere, some people with even more trouble than I've had are probably throwing a party upon using the smallest size.The sound quality seems on par with the ultra-high quality, cushioned, noise-cancelling gaming headsets I've had with two exceptions:1. Bass doesn't have quite the same resonance.2. Directional sound is limited.That being said, for ten bucks, trying these was one of the best purchase decisions I've ever made.I've bought five or six pairs and everyone I've given them to has come straight back to buy them again as soon as they needed more. My SO's pair is finally beginning to fail (in terms of the connection, not the sound) after a months of daily use for 8+ hours. Last week he asked plaintively if I could find more exactly like them, which prompted a discussion of their virtues (and this review.)Try these--you won't go back.

review: I replaced an old X-Power 700tw. This was more expensive, power-wise the old psu wasn't bad at all, but in terms of efficiency and noise, this is worth it, the fan only spins under heavy load, and it's minimal. The cables are flat, black and removable, very neat. Nice app available from Corsair to monitor the power and temperature of all devices: PSU, disks, CPU, motherboard, but not AMD graphics card unfortunately (can use GPU-ID for that, but would be very convenient if Corsair could add it).

review_bold: Just finished the book and loved it! I barely read anything
review: Oh my lord! That ending!!Just finished the book and loved it! I barely read anything, because to be honest, I don't have the patience and can't be bothered. But the Jessica Daniel's books are ace! Long enough to have a fantastic story, but short enough that I can read it in a week or so. Having read all the Daniels books (and the Silver Blackthorn and Andrew Hunter books) I can confidently say that I really enjoy Kerry Wilkinson's style, and the way he's build up Jessica's character is great.Really looking forward to seeing how the next book picks up the story!
